definition: at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out

sentences.english: I will not be stubborn, still can deal with time.
sentences.chinese: 不會再固執的我，依舊對時間沒轍。

sentences.english: I know he has a weakness for sweets.
sentences.chinese: 我知道他看到甜食就沒轍。

sentences.english: Crying is the baby's forte. Whenever she cries, her mother doesn't know how to deal with her.
sentences.chinese: 哭可是寶寶的拿手戲，只要她一哭，媽媽沒轍了。

sentences.english: When the girls tease him,he doesn't quite know how to act up.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘們拿他逗樂時，他就沒轍了。

sentences.english: If you absolutely had to, you could use a chain saw in a string quartet.
sentences.chinese: 實在沒轍，您拿鋸子也可以參加絃樂四重奏。

sentences.english: Obviously, plastic surgery is no option for this hag!
sentences.chinese: 顯然，整容手術也拿這個巫婆沒轍。

sentences.english: Well, you're basically out of luck.

definition: lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
